job_title: Senior Manager, Research, SPIN Work, Social Compliance
job_description: About BRAC:BRAC is an international development organisation founded in Bangladesh that partners with over 100 million people living with inequality and poverty globally to create sustainable opportunities to realise potential.Working at BRAC is not like any other job. It is a platform where you can bring about real change for people who need it the most. We are not just dreaming of a better world, we are building it. Join us to find the way.About Project: Gender-based violence and harassment (GBVH) remains a significant challenge in Bangladesh’s ready-made garment (RMG) sector, particularly for women workers. Despite existing safeguards, underreporting persists due to fear of retaliation and limited confidence in grievance mechanisms. The PRIMARK project focuses on designing an evidence-based, survivor-centered framework for prevention and remediation. The project emphasizes participatory learning, systems strengthening, and practical solutions tailored to factory realities. It will generate actionable insights and tools to inform programme aimed at fostering safer and more accountable workplaces.Job Purpose:The Senior Manager will lead the design and implementation of research and stakeholder engagement that ensures the co-creation project is evidence-driven, participatory, and aligned with safeguarding standards. The role will guide research, evidence generation, and quality assurance processes. It will synthesise insights from consultations and research to inform programme design. This position combines strategic MEL system design, qualitative and action research leadership, evidence synthesis, and programme framework development.Key Responsibilities:MEL System Design & ImplementationDesign and operationalise a comprehensive MEL framework emphasising process indicators to track progress, quality stakeholder diversity, and adherence to co-creation principles.Develop, manage, and refine data collection and documentation tools (e.g., feedback forms, observation checklists, consultation templates) to ensure systematic tracking of project activities.Ensure all MEL processes comply with organisational safeguarding protocols and data protection standards.Research Leadership & Evidence GenerationCapture and analyse insights from stakeholder consultations to identify emerging themes, evidence gaps, and priority research questions.Conduct structured secondary research, reviewing relevant literature, datasets, and programme reports (e.g., GIS, Better Work) to map existing knowledge and avoid duplication.Commission and oversee primary research, selecting research partners, and managing the full research lifecycle.Co-design and implement action research on survivor remedy pathways in collaboration with workers, factory management, and service providers.Evidence Quality Assurance & Programme DesignReview, validate, and triangulate all evidence products (diagnostic findings, research reports, gap analyses) to ensure methodological rigor and relevance.Facilitate peer review and validation sessions to strengthen credibility and inform programme development.Synthesise findings into a comprehensive evidence-driven report and lead the development of the Theory of Change, results framework, outcome indicators, and baseline recommendations for the proposed programme.Documentation, Learning & ReportingLead systematic documentation of lessons learned, challenges, and best practices.Prepare high-quality MEL inputs for monthly updates, quarterly learning briefs, and the final project report.Facilitate internal and external knowledge sharing in alignment with the Communication Plan.Safeguarding Responsibilities:Ensure the safety of Programmeme Participants, people who come into contact with the organisation and team members from any harm, abuse, neglect, harassment and exploitation including sexual exploitation and abuse (SEA) to achieve the programmeme's goals of safeguarding implementation. Act as a key source of support, guidance and expertise on safeguarding for establishing a safe working environment.Practice, promote and endorse the issues of safeguarding policy among team members and ensure the implementation of safeguarding standards in every course of action.Follow the safeguarding reporting procedure in case any reportable incident takes place and encourage others to do so.Additional Job Requirements:In-depth understanding of MEL principles for programme design and research; strong knowledge of GBVH, ethical research standards, and the RMG sector; familiarity with donor reporting requirements.Advanced skills in qualitative and quantitative data analysis software (e.g., SPSS, STATA, NVivo, or similar); excellent report writing and data visualization skills; strong facilitation and documentation skills.Analytical and strategic thinking; meticulous attention to detail; high integrity in handling sensitive data; collaborative team player; commitment to survivor-centred and ethical practices.Educational Requirements:Master's

job_title: Project Manager, SPIN Work, Social Compliance
job_description: About BRAC:BRAC is an international development organisation founded in Bangladesh that partners with over 100 million people living with inequality and poverty globally to create sustainable opportunities to realise potential.Working at BRAC is not like any other job. It is a platform where you can bring about real change for people who need it the most. We are not just dreaming of a better world, we are building it. Join us to find the way.About Project: Gender-based violence and harassment (GBVH) remains a significant challenge in Bangladesh’s ready-made garment (RMG) sector, particularly for women workers. Despite existing safeguards, underreporting persists due to fear of retaliation and limited confidence in grievance mechanisms. The PRIMARK project focuses on designing an evidence-based, survivor-centered framework for prevention and remediation. The project emphasizes participatory learning, systems strengthening, and practical solutions tailored to factory realities. It will generate actionable insights and tools to inform programme aimed at fostering safer and more accountable workplaces.Job Purpose:The Project Manager will lead the planning, implementation, and coordination of a 12-month co-creation project, ensuring efficient resource utilisation and timely delivery of all project milestones. The incumbent will oversee project reporting, stakeholder engagement, and effective partnership management with Primark. The role includes supervising evidence generation through research and facilitating the collaborative design of a future GBVH prevention and remediation programme in Bangladesh’s garment sector.Key Responsibilities:Project Management & Resource OversightLead the 12-month project from planning to final programme design, ensuring delivery on time, within scope, and budget (GBP 93,503).Manage and optimise human and project resources efficiently.Monitor expenditures and secure prior approval for any non-budgeted costs.Partnership & Stakeholder EngagementServe as BRAC’s primary liaison with Primark, ensuring transparent communication and governance.Implement the stakeholder engagement plan, facilitating consultations, workshops, and safe survivor-centred dialogues on GBVH issues.Research & Evidence GenerationCoordinate all research activities, ensuring alignment with project gaps and complementing existing initiatives.Synthesise findings to inform the evidence-based programme design.Reporting, Advocacy & FundraisingPrepare high-quality donor reports and contribute to programme documentation.Support joint advocacy and fundraising planning with Primark and partners.Compliance & SafeguardingEnsure adherence to donor requirements, BRAC policies, and data protection standards.Act as Safeguarding Focal Point, responding to GBVH cases confidentially and facilitating appropriate referrals.Safeguarding Responsibilities:Ensure the safety of Programmeme Participants, people who come into contact with the organisation and team members from any harm, abuse, neglect, harassment and exploitation including sexual exploitation and abuse (SEA) to achieve the programmeme's goals of safeguarding implementation. Act as a key source of support, guidance and expertise on safeguarding for establishing a safe working environment.Practice, promote and endorse the issues of safeguarding policy among team members and ensure the implementation of safeguarding standards in every course of action. Follow the safeguarding reporting procedure in case any reportable incident takes place and encourage others to do so.Additional Job Requirements:Understanding of GBVH, Labor laws, national/global safeguarding standards, the RMG sector in Bangladesh, and project cycle management.Exceptional stakeholder facilitation and consensus-building; strong research coordination and analytical skills; excellent communication and report writing; financial and operational management.Highly collaborative; adaptable in co-creation process; culturally sensitive; strong integrity; committed to survivor-centred and ethical practices; able to work independently and under pressure.Educational Requirements:Master's Degree in any relevant discipline (Social Sciences, Development Studies, Gender Studies, Law). Professional certification in Project Management (e.g., PMP) is preferrable.Experience Requirements:Minimum of 8 years of experience in NGO/international development, with at least 5 years in project/programme management.Benefits:Festival Bonus, Health and Life Insurance, Wellness Centre Facility, Day Care Facility, and others as per policy.Job Location: Dhaka, BangladeshHow to Apply:If you believe that you have what it takes to excel in this role, please apply through bdjobs or send your updated resume to resume@brac.net by March 14, 2026.This position is open for Bangladeshi nationals only.BRAC believes that everyone we work with—including our staff, programmeme participants, partners, and the communities we serve—has the right to be protected fr

job_description: Nature Conservation Management (NACOM) is looking for Gender OfficerJob Description / ResponsibilityReport To: Project Coordinator / Team LeaderLocation: Cox’s Bazar (Five Upazilas: Cox’s Bazar Sadar, Ukhiya, Teknaf, Maheshkhali, and Kutubdia)Contract Type: 12–14 monthsThe Fisheries Livelihood Enhancement Project (FiLEP) is implemented by the Department of Fisheries (DoF) with technical and financial support from JICA, aiming to enhance the resilience and livelihood security of artisanal fishing communities in Cox’s Bazar. The Gender Officer will be responsible for mainstreaming gender and social inclusion across all FiLEP-LNC interventions, with particular attention to women’s participation in livelihood diversification, livestock- and fisheries-related AIGAs, including other trades, household nutrition, and decision-making processes. About the JobAs Senior Compliance & Risk Manager (f/m/d), you will lead KuCoin EU’s key operational resilience pillars, including Third-Party Risk Management (TPRM) and ICT risk management. You will ensure that our governance, processes, and controls comply with MiCAR, DORA, EU GDPR, and Austrian regulatory expectations while supporting strong cross-functional collaboration. In this role, you will manage due diligence and oversight of external service providers, maintain the ICT risk framework and central risk register, support incident and vendor monitoring, and prepare clear reporting for the Head of Risk, Management Board and relevant committees.Working at KuCoin EUWork at the heart of it. Our modern Vienna office is located directly at the historic Trabrennbahn in the Prater - a vibrant and accessible location.Team culture matters. We believe in strong collaboration and organize regular team events to foster a positive and connected work environment.We take care of the details. A daily selection of snacks, beverages, and weekly Friday breakfasts help keep our team energized.An international mindset. Join a diverse, forward-thinking team that thrives on innovation and cross-border collaboration.Invest in your development. We offer clear career progression, supported by learning and development opportunities tailored to your professional growth.Rewarding performance. Benefit from a competitive salary, performance-based bonuses, and a comprehensive benefits package on top.Shape the industry. Make a direct contribution to one of Europe’s most ambitious crypto platforms as we scale our regulatory capabilities.What makes You specialYou hold a university degree in Law, Economics, Finance, Business, IT Risk, or a related fieldYou have 4+ years of experience in compliance, risk management, audit, or internal control (financial services/fintech/crypto experience is a strong plus)You bring practical expertise in TPRM, ICT risk governance, or EU GDPR-related compliance workYou can interpret system diagrams, vulnerability reports, penetration tests, and security certificationsYou understand European and Austrian regulatory frameworks, including DORA, MiCAR, NIS2, and relevant ISO standardsYou can translate regulatory requirements into clear, actionable, and scalable processesYou communicate well and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and external partnersYou are proactive, detail-oriented, and comfortable working in a fast-evolving regulatory environmentYou are fluent in English; German proficiency is a strong advantageJoin us.At KuCoin EU, you will be part of a team committed to innovation, integrity, and regulatory excellence. If you’re ready to contribute to the future of finance in a fast-moving, global environment - we look forward to hearing from you.KuCoin EU is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or age. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds and experiences.Detailed Job DescriptionYour MissionAs a Senior Compliance & Risk Manager, you will play a key role in strengthening our compliance and risk management framework, including Third-Party Risk Management (TPRM) and ICT Risk Management. Working across Risk Management, IT Security and Compliance, you will ensure the company meets its regulatory obligations under MiCAR, DORA, MiFID II, PSD II and related frameworks, while building a robust governance environment and effectively mitigating risks arising from external service providers. You are also expected to prepare regular risk and continuity reports for the Head of Risk, Management Board and relevant committees.What You Will DoThird-Party Risk ManagementLead and further develop the company’s Third-Party Risk Management (TPRM) framework, ensuring alignment with DORA, MiCAR, EU GDPR, and ICT risk expectationsConduct pre-contract due diligence, risk classification, and criticality assessments—including EU GDPR data protection impact assessments where relevantMaintain and enhance the DORA-compliant ICT Third-Party Register, ensuring complete, accurate, and up-to-date documentationEnsure that ICT outsourcing and third-party contracts include mandatory clauses required by DORA and EU GDPR (including audit/access rights, data protection terms, breach notification, subcontractor conditions, termination, and exit rights)Lead the ongoing monitoring of third-party service providers, including performance reviews, compliance checks, EU GDPR adherence, and ICT risk assessmentsDrive the oversight of critical ICT service providers, coordinating with ICT Security, Risk Management, and Legal to ensure enhanced governanceSupport the development and maintenance of exit strategies, contingency plans, business continuity, and data protection mitigation plans for outsourced

JR0127673Regulatory Compliance Senior Manager – WienSind Sie bereit, die regulatorische Zukunft einer internationalen Bank mitzugestalten? Bei der Western Union International Bank (WUIB) verbinden wir Menschen und Unternehmen weltweit – sicher, schnell und zuverlässig. Mit unserer Beyond-Strategie gehen wir über Geldtransfers hinaus und entwickeln innovative Lösungen, die das Leben unserer Kunden einfacher machen und ihnen helfen, finanziell voranzukommen. Compliance ist dabei der Schlüssel für Vertrauen und nachhaltiges Wachstum.In dieser Rolle sind Sie die zentrale Schnittstelle zur FMA und europäischen Aufsichtsbehörden. Sie überwachen regulatorische Entwicklungen, beraten Führungskräfte und begleiten neue Produkte und Märkte. Wir sind ein vielfältiges, kundenorientiertes Team von über 8.000 Mitarbeitenden in 200 Ländern und Regionen. Job SummaryAs a Risk and Compliance Specialist for Token Listing and Daily Operations at Bybit's EU Station, you will handle risk assessments, compliance reviews for token listings, and daily risk management for spot trading and lending activities. This role combines legal/regulatory expertise with operational risk monitoring to ensure zero risk incidents in the EU market. You will replicate global station risk practices while adapting to EU-specific regulations (e.g., MiCA) and liquidity conditions. Collaborating with compliance, business development, product, and risk teams, you will support secure token listings and maintain robust daily operations.Key ResponsibilitiesToken Listing Risk and Compliance ReviewProvide guidance on legal, regulatory, and risk aspects of token listings, including classification, jurisdictional considerations, and compliance with EU regulations.Review token listing applications for adherence to legal standards, conducting due diligence on whitepapers, tokenomics, project structures, and legal opinions.Coordinate with external counsel and regulators to mitigate risks and support licensing processes.Draft, review, and negotiate listing agreements, announcements, and documentation (e.g., spot trading rules).Monitor global and EU-specific regulatory developments in digital assets and advise on impacts to listing activities.Partner with internal teams to develop and implement listing governance frameworks, policies, and risk matrices.Support token delistings or adjustments based on evolving risks, compliance issues, or market surveillance (e.g., abnormal fluctuation analysis, ST/delisting procedures).Perform risk assessments for new listings, including symbols index, global/EU procedure checks, and integration with EU crypto loan systems.Daily Risk Operations (Spot Trading and Lending)Evaluate and adjust trading interface risk parameters (e.g., price/quantity precision, minimum trade amount consistent with global standards; maximum trade quantity based on EU liquidity).Manage price limit ratios, calculating based on EU liquidity, maintaining evaluation cycles aligned with global practices, and building data dashboards for monitoring.Establish and maintain Lark workflows for parameter approvals, adjustments, and emergency processes.Handle collateral delisting and discount rate adjustments, conducting risk assessments and user notifications prior to changes to prevent forced repayments or liquidations.Monitor lending pool overdrafts, managing alerts, operational responses, and emergency handling.Build and utilize data dashboards for ongoing risk evaluation; ensure all processes consider EU specificities.Support INS Loan and crypto loan upper limits, evaluating market fluctuations and integrating with global/EU systems.QualificationsBachelor's degree in Law, Finance, Risk Management, or a related field.3+ years of experience in risk management, compliance, or legal roles within fintech, blockchain, or cryptocurrency exchanges.Strong knowledge of global crypto regulations (e.g., MiCA, SEC, securities laws) and experience with token listings, due diligence, and risk assessments.Familiarity with trading parameters, liquidity calculations, lending operations, and tools like data dashboards or workflow systems (e.g., Lark).Excellent analytical, communication, and stakeholder management skills; ability to work in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment.Proficiency in English; multilingual capabilities (e.g., Chinese) a plus for handling global/EU documentation.Preferred SkillsPrior experience at a crypto exchange or fintech firm, with hands-on involvement in EU-specific operations.Understanding of tokenomics, smart contracts, liquidity models, and risk tools (e.g., for overdraft alerts or parameter automation).Experience building processes for zero-risk goals, including adaptations from global to regional stations.岗位摘要作为Bybit EU站的代币上市及日常风险运营风险与合规专员，您将负责代币上市的风险评估、合规审查，以及现货交易和借贷活动的日常风险管理。该职位结合法律/监管专业知识与运营风险监控，确保EU市场实现零风险事件目标。您将“复制”全球站的风险实践，同时适应EU特定法规（如MiCA）和流动性条件。与合规、业务开发、产品和风险团队合作，支持安全的代币上市并维护稳健的日常运营。主要职责代币上市风险与合规审查提供代币上市的法律、监管和风险指导，包括分类、管辖权考虑，以及符合EU法规（如某些参数无监管要求，但需与合规负责人确认调整）。审查代币上市申请是否符合法律标准，对白皮书、代币经济学、项目结构和法律意见进行尽职调查。与外部律师和监管机构协调，减轻风险并支持许可流程。起草、审查和谈判上市协议、公告以及文档（如现货交易规则）。监控全球和EU特定数字资产监管发展，并就对上市活动的影响提供建议。与内部团队合作，开发和实施上市治理框架、政策和风险矩阵。支持基于演变风险、合规问题或市场监控的代币下架或调整（如异常波动分析、ST/下架程序）。执行新上市的风险评估，包括符号索引、全球/EU程序检查，以及与EU加密贷款系统的集成。日常风险运营（现货交易和借贷）评估和调整交易界面风险参数（如价格/数量精度、最小交易金额与全球标准一致；最大交易数量基于EU流动性）。管理价格限额比例，基于EU流动性计算，保持与全球实践一致的评估周期，并构建数据仪表板进行监控。建立和维护Lark工作流，用于参数审批、调整和紧急流程。处理抵押品下架和折扣率调整，在变更前进行风险评估和用户通知，以防止强制还款或平仓。监控借贷池透支，管理警报、运营响应和紧急处理。构建和利用数据仪表板进行持续风险评估；确保所有流程考虑EU特定性。支持INS贷款和加密贷款上限，评估市场波动并与全球/EU系统集成。任职资格法律、金融、风险管理或相关领域学士学位。在金融科技、区块链或加密货币交易所的风险管理、合规或法律角色有3年以上经验。具备全球加密法规的扎实知识（如MiCA、SEC、证券法），以及代币上市、尽职调查和风险评估经验。熟悉交易参数、流动性计算、借贷运营，以及数据仪表板或工作流系统（如Lark）等工具。出色的分析、沟通和利益相关者管理技能；能够在快节奏、跨职能环境中工作。精通英语；多语言能力（如中文）有助于处理全球/EU文档。优先技能在加密交易所或金融科技公司有先前经验，并亲身参与EU特定运营。了解代币经济学、智能合约、流动性模型和风险工具（如透支警报或参数自动化）。有构建零风险目标流程的经验，包括从全球到区域站

zeb ist eine der führenden, auf den Finanzdienstleistungssektor spezialisierten Strategie-, Management und IT- Beratungen in Europa. Wir unterstützen Banken, Versicherungen und (Tech) Dienstleister bei allen Herausforderungen und Chancen, die sich aus dem Wandel der Branche ergeben.Deine Aufgaben:Als Leiter:in von (Teil-)Projekten im Bereich IT-Compliance und Informationssicherheit analysierst du die individuellen Kundenbedürfnisse und entwickelst maßgeschneiderte Sicherheitslösungen. Du erarbeitest eine umfassende Cyber-Security-Strategie, indem du:die aktuellen Cyber-Security-Bedrohungen, Schwachstellen und Risiken identifizierst,die IT-Governance-Standards an das institutseigene Framework anpasst, technische und organisatorische Sicherheitsmaßnahmen implementierst,robuste IT-Compliance, IT-Resilienz und Business-Continuity-Strategien (BCM) entwickelst,Optimierungspotenziale in den entsprechenden Governance-Prozessen und ‑Systemen (u. a. GRC-Tools) ermittelst. Durch deine aktive Beteiligung an Akquisen trägst du maßgeblich zur Stärkung der (Cyber-)Resilienz unserer Kunden bei und festigst langfristige Partnerschaften. Als coachende:r Mentor:in förderst du den Teamerfolg und treibst deine eigene Karriere voran, indem du kontinuierlich Erfahrungen sammelst und dein Netzwerk erweiterst. Dabei baust du den Themenbereich IT Compliance & Resilience aktiv weiter aus. Deine Skills:Du hast ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium sowie ISACA-Zertifizierungen wie CRISC und CISM. Zusätzlich bringst du Erfahrung als Information Security Officer oder Compliance Management Officer mit und bist vertraut mit COBIT und ITIL. Du verfügst über mehrjährige Berufs-/Projekterfahrung in IT-Compliance, ‑Governance, -Risikomanagement sowie Information Security, insbesondere in regulierten Umgebungen wie Banken und Beratungsunternehmen. Du kennst die aufsichtsrechtlichen Anforderungen der EZB, BaFin/Bundesbank und das regulatorische Umfeld der IT-Sicherheit. Kenntnisse in Xait, MaRisk, EBA GL on ICT und eventuell DORA runden dein Profil ab. Du arbeitest gerne im Team an analytischen Herausforderungen, hast den Mut, gewohnte fachliche und technische Strukturen infrage zu stellen, und willst dich weiterentwickeln. Du verfügst über Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse mindestens auf dem Niveau C1. Deine BenefitsVersicherung & Altersvorsorge: Sicher unterwegs mit zeb – über eine Gruppenunfallversicherung bist du auch privat in Deutschland versichert. Für Auslandsdienstreisen besteht eine zusätzliche Auslandsversicherung, und für deine Altersvorsorge kannst du über zeb eine betriebliche Altersvorsorge abschließen. Mobiles Arbeiten: Durch unsere technische Ausstattung ist mobiles Arbeiten von überall möglich – unabhängig davon, ob du gerade im Zug, zu Hause oder im Office bist. zeb.life: Dein Leben verändert sich – und wir möchten dich in den verschiedenen Phasen begleiten. Mit zeb.life findest du Unterstützung beispielsweise bei der Kinderbetreuung, im Lebenslagenmanagement und Eldercare oder bei der Suche nach Conciergediensten. Arbeitszeitmodelle: Bei uns gilt für alle Mitarbeitenden das Prinzip „trust-based hours“ für flexible Arbeitszeiten. Für Festangestellte sind auch Teilzeitmodelle möglich: Unter Berücksichtigung deines Projekts kannst du in Absprache mit deinem:deiner CDC (Career Development Counselor) dein Modell entwickeln und nach Bedarf anpassen. Gestalte dein Arbeitszeitmodell sowie deine Stunden damit nach deinen privaten Anforderungen und passe deine Arbeitszeiten an deine persönliche Situation an. Als Vertragsoption bietet das Modell "Family & More" zudem eine Garantie für reisefreie Wochentage, die vertraglich fixiert sind. Je nach Umfang der Reduzierung der Reisezeit erfolgt eine zeitlich befristete Gehaltsanpassung. Chancengleichheit für alle: Wir freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen mit unterschiedlichsten Hintergründen – unabhängig von Alter, Behinderung, ethnischer Zugehörigkeit, Nationalität, Geschlecht, Religion, sexueller Identität oder sozialer Herkunft. Als Arbeitgeber setzen wir auf Menschen, die gern Neues ausprobieren, Verantwortung übernehmen und andere durch ihr Tun inspirieren.

Erste Group was founded in 1819 as the first Austrian savings bank and today it is one of the largest banking groups in Central and Eastern Europe (CEE). As an attractive employer, Erste Group offers interesting career opportunities in an international environment.Group Regulatory Compliance is responsible for steering regulatory compliance risks acc. to § 39 Abs. 6 BWG. The unit regularly monitors compliance risks in Erste Group’s processes using internal and external control frameworks. Regulatory compliance risks are regularly assessed in a holistic risk assessment and reported to both internal management and external stakeholders. When necessary – the unit initiates and tracks mitigation measures to ensure a prudent management of compliance risks.As part of the Regulatory Compliance Function, you use your regulatory, legal and/or compliance expertise to ensure Erste Group’s compliance with banking regulation. You contribute to a great team of experts to form a future-fit compliance function of Erste Group and its subsidiaries.In specific your tasks includeMonitoring relevant banking regulation, assessing the applicability to Erste Group, managing the bank-internal gapping process, and tracking the implementation within the bankMonitoring of compliance risks on a regular basis for a specific subset of regulatory topicsContributing to the management reporting and the bank’s risk assessmentSetting of group standards through policies and other guidelinesAssessing and driving further usage and implementation of technology in the area of relevant reg-techYour BackgroundUniversity degree in law or businessMinimum of 5 years industry experience, including in (regulatory) compliance, risk management or related areasYou have a high degree of banking/regulatory expertise and a good understanding of regulatory compliance risksYou are passionate about banking regulation (CRR/CRD, BWG and related guidelines) and related topics (i.a. Credit Risk, Operational Risk, Own Funds Requirements, Disclosures, Regulatory Reporting, ICAAP/ILAAP/SREP, Remuneration, ESG/Sustainability) and assessing their impact on Erste GroupYou demonstrate the ability to independently manage internal processes and to prepare presentation materials for senior managementYou are curious about new technology and know your way around Microsoft Office 365 applications (we highly welcome previous experience in working with SharePoint, Microsoft Lists, Power BI and Power Automate)Fluent in English and German (any CEE language would be an advantage)Our OfferWe are committed to support you in your professional and personal developmentWe offer the opportunity to work with a highly motivated and ambitious multi-national teamDiscover and enjoy the benefits of Erste GroupThe minimum wage for this full-time position in accordance with the collective agreement with complete fulfillment of the functional profile is EUR 49.772,80 gross per year. But this is just a formality - we would be happy to talk about your actual salary in person!We offer our employees the opportunity to divide their hours between working from home and at the office.We consider the diversity of our employees as key to innovation and success. As employer we are proud to offer everyone equal chances, irrespective of age, skin colour, religious belief, gender, sexual orientation or origin.ContactSarah Elisabeth Himler

Standort: Wien | Stundenausmaß: Vollzeit | ab sofortDu willst Regulatorik und Compliance nicht nur verstehen, sondern aktiv mitgestalten? Bei EY arbeitest du im Financial Services Consulting an der Schnittstelle zwischen Aufsicht, Risiko und Innovation.Du unterstützt Banken, FinTechs und Finanzdienstleister dabei, zentrale FMA‑ und EBA‑Anforderungen in moderne, praxistaugliche Lösungen zu verwandeln – hybrid, international und mitten aus unserem Wiener Büro mit Blick auf Alte & Neue Donau.Das erwartet dich bei uns — Aufgaben, die Banking wirklich verändernRegulatorik & Compliance neu denken: Du tauchst tief in Themen wie Financial Crime Compliance (FCC), Capital Market Compliance (CMC), KYC, Datenschutz und Governance ein – und entwickelst Lösungen, die Banken wirklich weiterbringen. Aufsicht im Wandel gestalten: Gemeinsam mit unseren Kund:innen interpretierst und operationalisierst du aktuelle FMA‑ und EBA‑Vorgaben sowie weitere regulatorische Anforderungen wie CRR/CRD oder ESG‑Regulatorik.Beratung mit Impact: Du arbeitest direkt mit Fachabteilungen und Entscheidungsträger:innen zusammen, analysierst Herausforderungen und entwickelst klare, umsetzbare Empfehlungen für die Finanzwelt von morgen.Projekte vorantreiben: Du gestaltest Workstreams, bereitest Präsentationen vor, strukturierst Inhalte und hältst Kund:innen sowie das Team auf Kurs.Impulse setzen: Ob Artikel, Studien oder interne Initiativen – du bringst eigene Ideen ein und prägst aktiv, wie wir im Bereich Regulatory & Compliance wachsen.Zusammenarbeit, die Spaß macht: Du arbeitest eng mit Kolleg:innen aus unterschiedlichen Disziplinen zusammen, baust Know‑how auf und gibst es weiter, um das Team gemeinsam stärker zu machenDas bringst du mit — Fähigkeiten, mit denen du die Zukunft gestalten wirstAbgeschlossenes Studium in Wirtschaft, Finance, Banking, Recht oder einem vergleichbaren Fachbereich Solide Erfahrung in Banking‑Regulatorik oder Compliance – etwa im Umgang mit FMA-/EBA‑Vorgaben, KYC/AML, Financial Crime, Datenschutz, Governance oder RisikothemenErfahrung in einem Umfeld, in dem komplexe Fragestellungen analysiert und in strukturierte, umsetzbare Lösungen übersetzt werdenBeratungserfahrung ist ein PlusVerständnis für aufsichtsrechtliche Anforderungen, um daraus klare und praxisorientierte Lösungen für Kund:innen abzuleitenAnalytische, strukturierte Arbeitsweise und sichere Kommunikationsskills, sowohl im Team als auch im direkten Austausch mit Kund:innen – unterstützt durch sehr gute Deutsch‑ und EnglischkenntnisseDas bieten wir dir — ein inspirierendes ArbeitsumfeldSchnelle Entwicklung: Bei uns entwickelst du dich fachlich wie persönlich rasch weiter – getragen von einem dynamischen, wachsenden TeamHervorragende Karrierechancen: Du profitierst von individueller Förderung, anspruchsvollen Projekten und unserem starken EY-NetzwerkWorktime & Workplace Flexibility: Eine unternehmensweite Homeoffice‑Policy, die Möglichkeit auf ein Sabbatical und bis zu 20 Tage Workation sorgen für viel FlexibilitätAttraktives Angebot an Aus- und Weiterbildungen: Du erhältst Zugang zu einem umfassenden Weiterbildungsangebot – inklusive Formaten wie dem EY Tech MBA der Hult International Business School.Community & Events: Exklusive Afterworks und Lounge‑Events mit kostenlosen Cocktails sowie „Coffee Mondays“ bieten dir regelmäßig Raum für Austausch und gute Stimmung.Attraktive Fringe Benefits: Von Sport- und Gesundheitsangeboten bis zu Rabatten, Öffi-Zuschuss und legendären EY-Events – bei uns findest du nicht nur vielfältige Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten, sondern auch ein tolles Umfeld mit engagierten Menschen, die gemeinsam Großes bewegen. Du möchtest wissen, wie dein Arbeitsalltag im Financial Services Team aussieht? Dann schau auf unserem EY Instagram Kanal vorbei.EY ist ein Unternehmen, das die Chancengleichheit fördert. Wir schätzen die Vielfalt individueller Identitäten und legen großen Wert auf ein inklusives Arbeitsklima, in dem sich jede:r wohl fühlt.Diese Position deckt sich mit deinem Profil und deinen Vorstellungen? Dann übermittle uns deinen Lebenslauf inkl. Zeugnisse noch heute über unser Online-Tool. Mehr über unseren Bewerbungsprozess erfährst du hier.Für Rückfragen steht dir unser Recruiting Team gerne zur Verfügung.Weitere Informationen findest du auf unserer Karriere Website oder beim interaktiven Durchklicken auf meetEY.Für diese Position beträgt das kollektivvertragliche Mindestgehalt € 3.157,47 (All-in) – das erscheint dir wenig? Keine Sorge: Das tatsächliche Gehalt hängt von deiner Berufserfahrung und Qualifikation ab. Und das Beste: Es steigt jährlich!

SPARFELL is a family-owned company operating in business aviation. We operate a fleet of more than 20 business jets, and to complement the company’s growth, we are looking for an experienced Flight Operations Compliance Monitoring Manager to join our team in Vienna. Compliance Monitoring Manager – Flight Operations Responsibilities Responsible for the administration and maintenance of the compliance monitoring function Maintaining the Compliance Monitoring Manual up to date in line with aviation standards Ensure that the compliance monitoring programme is properly implemented, maintained and continually reviewed Responsible for the timely scheduling of audits according to the audit plan Ensuring the independence and objectivity of internal auditors Monitor the recording, implementation, completion and effectiveness of the corrective and preventive actions Provide training in connection with the Compliance Management System Review of changes to procedures Support the Civil Aviation Authority during audits Your profil Extensive and relevant experience in a compliance monitoring function Holds an auditing techniques certification or qualification Has previous experience in conducting audits and inspections Knowledge of aviation regulations, in particular European Commission regulations, AMCs and GMs Knowledge of IS-BAO standards Minimum five years of practical experience in flight operations, including experience in operational management or other operational oversight functions (e.g. compliance, training, safety) Ability to communicate well in English in both oral and written formats Based in Vienna or willing to relocate. If you feel this position matches your skills and motivation, even if you do not meet all listed requirements, we look forward to your application. Please send your application including your CV to: contact.vienna@sparfell.aero ﻿Please note that applications submitted directly via LinkedIn will not be considered

job_title: Global Trade Compliance Officer (all genders) - DE

job_description: This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Projects Directorate (PJ), Innovation & Competitiveness Department (INCO), Circular Economy and Sustainable Development Division (CESDEV), at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an Environmental Specialist *. This is a full-time position at grade 5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.internal benchmark: Transversal SpecialistPanel interviews are foreseen as from January 2026.PurposeAs an Environmental Specialist within the Circular Economy and Sustainable Development Division (CESDEV) of the INCO Department, you will play a key role in advancing sustainable initiatives across a truly international organization. Reporting directly to the Head of Division, your work will span all Divisions within the INCO Department, giving you broad exposure and the opportunity to collaborate with top-tier professionals, including social, climate, and environmental advisors. You will also coordinate with Environmental and Social Specialists from other departments, the team in the Environment, Climate & Social Office (ECSO), and other EIB officers, especially those involved in INCO lending operations. Your expertise will be vital in managing external Environmental consultants, further expanding your professional network.Join us and take your career to the next level while contributing to sustainable development across Europe and beyond.Operating NetworkYou’ll work closely with project teams in the INCO Department, offering expert advice on environmental due diligence and monitoring across a range of sectors covered by the department’s mandate (bioeconomy, life science and health, heavy industries, digital infrastructure and manufacturing). Your guidance will support compliance with EIB Environmental and Social Policies. This is an opportunity to play a meaningful role in advancing sustainable and innovative projects across Europe.This position offers a high level of autonomy and the chance to build valuable relationships with international financial institutions, public authorities, and EU institutions. You will represent the EIB at high-level project meetings with promoters and EU counterparts, showcasing your skills and making a meaningful impact. You may also participate in cross-departmental projects, enhancing your experience and visibility within the organization.Business travel is a core component of the position, including missions to non-EU countries such as the Eastern Neighbourhood, South and East Mediterranean, Latin America (LATAM), Central Asia, and Sub-Saharan Africa.AccountabilitiesOffer expert guidance on environmental risk assessments and due diligence for individual projects, ensuring each project meets EIB environmental standards.Review environmental and social assessments and related studies to verify their quality and completeness.Help prepare appraisal reports for high-risk projects and may participate in appraisal missions to assess EIB support.Support the development of legal requirements related to environmental standards in project agreements.Monitor ongoing projects to confirm compliance with environmental commitments and the achievement of expected development outcomes.Provide advice to project teams on handling environmental complaints and information requests, following regulations and EIB policies.Assist in organizing consultancy services for environmental due diligence and specialized studies.Contribute to creating and applying the Bank’s environmental and social standards, and represent your department in working groups.Prepare management briefings on key environmental and social issues.Help develop and deliver training on EIB environmental standards for staff and project promotersQualificationsUniversity degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in a relevant field (e.g. environmental and natural science/management/engineering, development studies, economics or another relevant discipline);At least 5 years of recent and relevant professional experience related to environmental due diligence and/or the application of international environmental best practices in the sectors listed above, (preference will be given to a candidate managing complex tasks/projects);Sound knowledge of international good practice related to Environmental due diligence frameworks, processes and tools and solid experience in their application in a project context Demonstrated ability to work in inter-disciplinary contexts;Experience of working with a wide range of stakeholders, including governments, civil society, and local communities;Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (***).It Would Be An Advantage If You HaveExperience in emerging markets and/or developing countries ;Experience in and expos

Über unsMaking it happen. That’s law. Shaping the future. That’s law. fwp. That’s law.Unsere tägliche Arbeit ist von Werten geprägt, die uns zu dem machen, was wir sind - eine der Top-Wirtschaftssozietäten in Österreich. Kompetenz, Teamgeist und Zielorientierung bilden unsere Eckpfeiler. Mit rund 140 Mitarbeiter:innen, davon über 70 Jurist:innen, bieten wir unseren Mandant:innen in interdisziplinären Praxisgroups die perfekte Mischung aus fachspezifischem Know-how und jahrelanger Erfahrung. Werden auch Sie Teil des erfolgreichen fwp.TEAMs!Das erwartet SieMitarbeit an der Lösung rechtlich komplexer und wirtschaftlich bedeutender Fragestellungen für Unternehmen aus unterschiedlichen Branchen als Teil eines auf Zivilprozesse spezialisierten Teams.Sie verfassen Schriftsätze, nehmen an Verhandlungen teil, erstellen Einschätzungen im Zuge von vorprozessualen Risikobewertungen und lösen, gemeinsam mit Ihrem Team, komplexe Sachverhalte für unsere nationalen und internationalen Mandant:innen.Sie werden sich unter anderem mit Rechtsfragen und Prozessen aus den Bereichen Bankenrecht, Compliance, Finanzierungen, Kapitalmarkttransaktionen, Insolvenzstreitigkeiten sowie streitiges Gesellschaftsrecht befassen.Daneben unterstützen Sie - gemeinsam mit Ihrem Team - Mandant:innen beim Aufbau und der Weiterentwicklung von Compliance-Management-Systeme sowie bei der Durchführung von internen Untersuchungen zur Aufklärung von Malversationen und der anschließende Prüfung und Durchsetzung von zivil- und strafrechtlichen Ansprüchen.Das bringen Sie mitErste Erfahrung als Associate im Bereich Dispute Resolution und/oder Compliance; gerne auch bereits absolvierte Rechtsanwaltsprüfung.Sie haben einen Sinn für ökonomische Zusammenhänge, verfügen über hervorragende juristische Qualifikationen und sehr gute Englischkenntnisse.Zusatzqualifikationen, wie ein im englischsprachigen Ausland erworbener LL.M., eine Promotion und/oder eine fachlich einschlägige Lehrstuhltätigkeit sind willkommen.Freude an der Zusammenarbeit in einem Team, hohe Einsatz- und Lernbereitschaft und Sie bleiben selbst in stressigen Situationen qualitätsorientiert.Darauf können Sie sich freuenModerne Büroräumlichkeiten in Wiener Top-Lage neben dem Juridicum mit Einzelbüros für unsere Jurist:innen und sehr guter VerkehrsanbindungÜbernahme der Kosten für die Jahreskarte der Wiener LinienEffizientes und flexibles Arbeitsumfeld mit Homeoffice-Möglichkeit dank unseres fwp.ANYWHERE KonzeptsEine freundliche Atmosphäre in einem hochmotivierten und vielfältigen TeamEinfacher Einstieg in das fwp.TEAM durch ein maßgeschneidertes Onboarding und unser vielfach bewährtes fwp Buddy- und Mentor:innensystemSpannende Projekte namhafter nationaler und internationaler Mandant:innenIndividueller Karriereweg sowie sehr gute Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten mit unserem fwp.KNOWLEDGE-ProgrammZahlreiche fwp.TEAM-Events, ein fwp.HEALTH-Angebot und eine Vielzahl an weiteren BenefitsFür die Position ist ein Monatsentgelt ab EUR 3.700,-- brutto (auf Vollzeitbasis) vorgesehen. Zusätzlich übernehmen wir die RAK-Kosten in Höhe von EUR 331,-- pro Monat.Natürlich bezahlen wir bei herausragender Erfahrung, Qualifikation und bei Erfolgen auch gerne mehr!Bei fwp ist Vielfalt willkommen! Wir freuen uns, wenn Ihre Bewerbung unsere gelebte Diversität erweitert und wir Ihnen zeigen dürfen, was Chancengleichheit im fwp.TEAM bedeutet.

About the CompanyAt nyra health, we’re a scale-up in rapid growth with a hands-on culture. We’re looking for someone who enjoys building robust security and compliance foundations, is comfortable switching between policy and practice, and thrives in an environment where flexibility, pragmatism, and attention to detail are essential.This is a chance to own our Information Security Management System (ISMS), strengthen our privacy posture, and support our Quality Management System (QMS) as we scale in digital health.‍About the role‍As Information Security & Compliance Specialist, you will maintain and improve our ISMS (ISO 27001), lead privacy compliance (GDPR, HIPAA), and support aspects of our QMS (ISO 13485). You’ll plan and support audits, drive risk management end-to-end, and coordinate security operations such as vulnerability scanning and penetration testing. You’ll work closely with Product, Engineering, Operations, and Leadership to align technical controls with organizational processes and documentation.‍Responsibilities‍Information Security Management (ISO 27001)Maintain and improve the ISMS; manage the Statement of Applicability and control effectiveness. Plan, prepare, and support internal & external audits.ISMS Risk Management: Conduct risk assessments and threat modeling. Integrate security risks into product risk management (aligned with ISO 14971 principles).Coordinate regular vulnerability scans and penetration tests; drive remediation.Support operational security tasks (access reviews, incident response drills, backup/restore tests).Maintain an Asset Management System (hardware, software, services, data).Develop and deliver role-based training on ISO 27001, secure practices & GDPR.Quality Management Support (ISO 13485)Change Management: Support and monitor changes within the Integrated Management System (IMS) for ISO 13485 conformity.CAPA Management: Own CAPAs within your scope, ensuring timely implementation, root-cause analysis, corrective actions, and documentation.‍What You Should BringUnderstanding of ISO 27001 and ISMS implementation/operationKnowledge of GDPR is beneficial. The Regulatory Compliance Unit, within the Group Compliance division, is responsible for developing and implementing a comprehensive framework, policies, and procedures to effectively monitor, assess, and mitigate regulatory compliance risks across the RBI Group. Join us as student (f/m/x) to assist us with the assessment of risks and the implementation of measures to control and mitigate non-compliance risks across RBI Group. At a glance: Start Date: As soon as possible Working Hours: 20per week Place of Employment: 1030 Vienna Your role with us on the team You support us in the development, implementation and maintenance of a comprehensive monitoring plan for regulatory compliance, focusing on § 69 (1) Austrian Banking Act. You support regulatory monitoring and interpretation of developments of regulatory requirements, especially BWG and EU directives. You support allocation of § 9 VStG responsible persons and communicate with various stakeholders. You support qualitative and quantitative risk assessments, scenario analysis and data analytics for risk monitoring. You assist in creating presentations to ensure regulatory compliance awareness in RBI Group. You assist the team in performing group steering functions, including deep dive assessments. You collaborate with cross-functional teams and support communication, change management and reporting across the CEE network. Your core competencies You are actively enrolled at a university in the field of law, business law, or comparable studies. You are fluent in English and German; other CEE languages are an advantage. Basic knowledge or interest in regulatory frameworks (BWG, EU law). You have a understanding of MS Office (e.g. Excel, PowerPoint, etc.). You are interested in learning more about regulatory developments and mitigations of regulatory risks. You are a team player with solid communication skills and ability to work with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment. What's in it for you Work & Study: The ability to gain practical experience in an international banking environment while continuing your studies Flexibility: Working hours adaptable to your university schedule and a balance of on-site and home-office days Onboarding: An easy start with a buddy from your team to guide you Community: Internal networking with other students Internationality: Operations in Central and Eastern Europe with English as the corporate language, providing a foundation for an international career Canteen: A wide variety of healthy, tasty, and heavily subsidized meal options Further Benefits: Shopping vouchers from the staff council (e.g., supermarkets), free museum tickets, attractive sports offers, fitness center membership allowance, and a reduced public transport ticket Compensation: An attractive monthly student salary of gross EUR 2,538.57 (based on 38.5 hours per week)
